verses.kjv: And after these things I heard a great voice of much people in heaven, saying, Alleluia; Salvation, and glory, and honour, and power, unto the Lord our God:
verses.web: After these things I heard something like a loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, saying, “Hallelujah! Salvation, power, and glory belong to our God;
verses.ct: After all this, I heard what sounded like the roar of a massive crowd in heaven, shouting, "Hallelujah! Salvation, glory, honor, and power belong to the Lord our God!"

verses.kjv: For true and righteous are his judgments: for he hath judged the great whore, which did corrupt the earth with her fornication, and hath avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.
verses.web: for his judgments are true and righteous. For he has judged the great prostitute, who corrupted the earth with her sexual immorality, and he has avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.”
verses.ct: "His judgments are true and right. He has condemned the great prostitute who corrupted the earth with her sexual immorality, and he has avenged the blood of his servants that she shed."

verses.kjv: And again they said, Alleluia.  And her smoke rose up for ever and ever.
verses.web: A second said, “Hallelujah! Her smoke goes up forever and ever.”
verses.ct: Then they cried out again, "Hallelujah! The smoke from her destruction rises forever and ever."

verses.kjv: And the four and twenty elders and the four beasts fell down and worshipped God that sat on the throne, saying, Amen; Alleluia.
verses.web: The twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God who sits on the throne, saying, “Amen! Hallelujah!”
verses.ct: The 24 elders and the 4 living creatures fell down and worshiped God, who sits on the throne, saying, "Amen! Hallelujah!"

verses.kjv: And a voice came out of the throne, saying, Praise our God, all ye his servants, and ye that fear him, both small and great.
verses.web: A voice came from the throne, saying, “Give praise to our God, all you his servants, you who fear him, the small and the great!”
verses.ct: Then a voice came from the throne: "Praise our God, all you who serve him — everyone who fears him, from the least to the greatest!"

verses.kjv: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of mighty thunderings, saying, Alleluia: for the Lord God omnipotent reigneth.
verses.web: I heard something like the voice of a great multitude, and like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of mighty thunders, saying, “Hallelujah! For the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns!
verses.ct: Then I heard what sounded like a vast crowd — like the roar of rushing waters, like the crash of mighty thunder — shouting, "Hallelujah! For the Lord God, the Almighty, reigns!

verses.kjv: Let us be glad and rejoice, and give honour to him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready.
verses.web: Let’s rejoice and be exceedingly glad, and let’s give the glory to him. For the wedding of the Lamb has come, and his wife has made herself ready.”
verses.ct: Let us celebrate and be overjoyed! Let us give him glory! For the wedding of the Lamb has arrived, and his bride has made herself ready."

verses.kjv: And to her was granted that she should be arrayed in fine linen, clean and white: for the fine linen is the righteousness of saints.
verses.web: It was given to her that she would array herself in bright, pure, fine linen: for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints.
verses.ct: She was given bright, pure, fine linen to wear — and that fine linen represents the righteous acts of God's people.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto me, Write, Blessed are they which are called unto the marriage supper of the Lamb. And he saith unto me, These are the true sayings of God.
verses.web: He said to me, “Write, ‘Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding supper of the Lamb.’ ” He said to me, “These are true words of God.”
verses.ct: The angel told me, "Write this down: 'Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding feast of the Lamb.'" Then he added, "These are the true words of God."

verses.kjv: And I fell at his feet to worship him. And he said unto me, See thou do it not: I am thy fellowservant, and of thy brethren that have the testimony of Jesus: worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.
verses.web: I fell down before his feet to worship him. He said to me, “Look! Don’t do it! I am a fellow bondservant with you and with your brothers who hold the testimony of Jesus. Worship God, for the testimony of Jesus is the Spirit of Prophecy.”
verses.ct: I fell at his feet to worship him, but he stopped me. "Don't do that!" he said. "I'm a fellow servant, just like you and your brothers who hold to the testimony of Jesus. Worship God! For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy."

verses.kjv: And I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that sat upon him was called Faithful and True, and in righteousness he doth judge and make war.
verses.web: I saw the heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and he who sat on it is called Faithful and True. In righteousness he judges and makes war.
verses.ct: Then I saw heaven standing open, and there before me was a white horse. Its rider is called Faithful and True, and he judges and wages war with perfect righteousness.

verses.kjv: His eyes were as a flame of fire, and on his head were many crowns; and he had a name written, that no man knew, but he himself.
verses.web: His eyes are a flame of fire, and on his head are many crowns. He has names written and a name written which no one knows but he himself.
verses.ct: His eyes blazed like fire, and on his head sat many crowns. He had a name written on him that no one knows except himself.

verses.kjv: And he was clothed with a vesture dipped in blood: and his name is called The Word of God.
verses.web: He is clothed in a garment sprinkled with blood. His name is called “The Word of God.”
verses.ct: He wore a robe dipped in blood, and his name is the Word of God.

verses.kjv: And the armies which were in heaven followed him upon white horses, clothed in fine linen, white and clean.
verses.web: The armies which are in heaven followed him on white horses, clothed in white, pure, fine linen.
verses.ct: The armies of heaven followed him on white horses, dressed in fine linen that was white and pure.

verses.kjv: And out of his mouth goeth a sharp sword, that with it he should smite the nations: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and he treadeth the winepress of the fierceness and wrath of Almighty God.
verses.web: Out of his mouth proceeds a sharp, double-edged sword, that with it he should strike the nations. He will rule them with an iron rod. He treads the wine press of the fierceness of the wrath of God, the Almighty.
verses.ct: A sharp sword came from his mouth to strike down the nations. He will rule them with an iron rod, and he treads the winepress of the fierce wrath of God, the Almighty.

verses.kjv: And he hath on his vesture and on his thigh a name written, KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.
verses.web: He has on his garment and on his thigh a name written, “KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.”
verses.ct: On his robe and on his thigh, a name was written: KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.

verses.kjv: And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the fowls that fly in the midst of heaven, Come and gather yourselves together unto the supper of the great God;
verses.web: I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the sky, “Come! Be gathered together to the great supper of God,
verses.ct: Then I saw an angel standing in the sun. He shouted to every bird flying overhead, "Come! Gather together for the great feast of God!

verses.kjv: That ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses, and of them that sit on them, and the flesh of all men, both free and bond, both small and great.
verses.web: that you may eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of captains, the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses and of those who sit on them, and the flesh of all men, both free and slave, small and great.”
verses.ct: Come and eat the flesh of kings, generals, and mighty warriors — the flesh of horses and their riders — the flesh of everyone, free and slave, small and great."

verses.kjv: And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies, gathered together to make war against him that sat on the horse, and against his army.
verses.web: I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies, gathered together to make war against him who sat on the horse, and against his army.
verses.ct: Then I saw the beast and the kings of the earth with their armies, assembled to wage war against the rider on the white horse and his army.

verses.kjv: And the beast was taken, and with him the false prophet that wrought miracles before him, with which he deceived them that had received the mark of the beast, and them that worshipped his image. These both were cast alive into a lake of fire burning with brimstone.
verses.web: The beast was taken, and with him the false prophet who worked the signs in his sight, with which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with sulfur.
verses.ct: But the beast was captured, along with the false prophet who had performed miraculous signs on the beast's behalf — signs that deceived everyone who had taken the mark of the beast and worshiped his image. Both of them were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with sulfur.

verses.kjv: And the remnant were slain with the sword of him that sat upon the horse, which sword proceeded out of his mouth: and all the fowls were filled with their flesh.
verses.web: The rest were killed with the sword of him who sat on the horse, the sword which came out of his mouth. All the birds were filled with their flesh.
verses.ct: The rest were killed by the sword that came from the mouth of the rider on the horse, and all the birds gorged themselves on their flesh.
